A 52-year-old male presents to the emergency department with abdominal pain, nausea, and bilious vomiting. He also complains of a painful bulge in his left groin that has been present for 4 hours. He is a known case of hypertension, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and hypothyroidism. He has no past surgical history. His initial vitals in the emergency room are: Temperature 37.5°C, heart rate 80, blood pressure 165/90, respirations 14, O2 saturation 93% on room air. On physical examination, he is moderately distended, and has mild tenderness to palpation throughout his abdomen, and a firm, painful bulge in his left groin above the inguinal ligament. There are no overlying skin changes in his groin. The next best step in the treatment of this patient would be:

options.text: Attempt manual reduction with light sedation

options.label: B
options.text: Obtain a CT scan of the abdomen

questions.correct_answer: A. Attempt manual reduction with light sedation

A 24-year-old woman with medically re ractory ulcerative colitis decides to undergo a total colectomy. During this procedure, where would it be most appropriate to look or the inferior mesenteric vein in order to ligate it?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The inferior mesenteric artery can be ligated within the peritoneum, where it joins with the superior mesenteric artery.

options.label: C
options.text: The inferior mesenteric vein is often ligated at the inferior edge of the pancreas, just below where it joins with the splenic vein.

options.label: D
options.text: The inferior mesenteric vein will not be ligated for this procedure.

questions.correct_answer: C. The inferior mesenteric vein is often ligated at the inferior edge of the pancreas, just below where it joins with the splenic vein.

options.text: The presence of elevated hCG is indicative of nonseminomatous histology

options.label: B
options.text: The half-life of hCG is 5 to 7 days

options.label: C
options.text: Very high levels of hCG can produce symptoms of hyperthyroidism

options.text: Very high levels of hCG are common in patients with disseminated yolk sac tumor

questions.correct_answer: C. Very high levels of hCG can produce symptoms of hyperthyroidism

While performing a laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication during the transhiatal dissection the mediastinal pleura is compromised and a CO2 pneumothorax develops. What is the initial preferred management o the pneumothorax?

options.label: A
options.text: Needle thoracostomy over the second intercostals space, mid-clavicular line

options.label: B
options.text: Enlargement of the defect and placement o an 18-French red rubber catheter across the defect.

options.label: C
options.text: Abort the procedure and emergent tube thoracostomy with a 28-French chest tube.

options.label: D
options.text: No intervention is needed. Continue with the planned procedure.

questions.correct_answer: B. Enlargement of the defect and placement o an 18-French red rubber catheter across the defect.
